titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for an event sponsored by the Specialty Equipment Market Association.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Mr. Gilchrest moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Referred to the Committee on Rules.

bill.summary: 5/7/1996--Passed House amended. Authorizes use of the Capitol grounds on May 16, 1996, for a free public event displaying racing, restored, and customized motor vehicles and transporters. Allows the event only after the Architect of the Capitol and the Capitol Police Board enter into an agreement that prohibits the sponsor and the vehicle owners and manufacturers from using any photograph taken at the event for commercial purposes.
